JournalEntry.title: JournalEntry
JournalEntry.description: Represents a single journal entry in the digital bible study journal.

id.description: Unique identifier for the JournalEntry entity.

bibleVerse.description: The bible verse reference for the entry (e.g., Psalms 23).

verseText.description: The text of the bible verse, ideally autocompleted based on Reina Valera 1960.

observation.description: Context and facts related to the verse.

practicalApplication.description: Personal commitments based on the verse and teaching.

tagIds.description: References to Tag. (Relationship: Tag N:N JournalEntry)

createdAt.description: Timestamp of when the entry was created.

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Represents a tag that can be applied to journal entries.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Tag entity.

name.description: The name of the tag (e.g., Oraci√≥n, Familia).

definition.description: Stores journal entries for a specific user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the journal entry.

params.name: journalEntryId
params.description: The unique ID of the journal entry.

definition.description: Stores tags created by a specific user.

params.name: userId
params.description: The ID of the user who owns the tag.

params.name: tagId
params.description: The unique ID of the tag.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure data ownership and secure access using path-based rules. Each user has a dedicated collection for their journal entries and tags, ensuring data isolation and simplified security rules. This design promotes Authorization Independence by avoiding `get()` calls in security rules and supports secure `list` operations.  The structure leverages hierarchical paths for user-owned data and continues the hierarchy for nested data.
